items.item_details: For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
This is an opportunity for members of the public to address the Committee concerning issues not listed on the agenda.

items.item_text: Board Legislative Committee will approve the meeting Agenda
items.item_text_raw: 1. Board Legislative Committee will approve the meeting Agenda

items.item_details:
The following information will be shared during the Board Committee on Legislation mtg:
	 
Board Composition:  Trustee President Wendy Ho, Chair; Trustee Mayra Cruz; Trustee Huong Nguyen; Staffed by Rosalie Ledesma, Exec Director of Government & External Affairs 
	 
Committee Charge: to recommend principles to guide the development of the Boardâs Strategic Legislative Agenda and Priorities for the Year, including the establishment of a process to:
Identify and monitor legislative issues that impact the district's strategic goals and secure Board approval of these specific legislative issues as the Committee's strategic focus for the year
Meet periodically with federal and state elected officials to advocate for Board approved legislative issues
Make recommendations to the Board, as needed, regarding potential Board position/action on Board approved legislative issues
Collaborate with state and local organizations, both professional/educational and community-based, to advocate for Board approved legislative issues, according to all federal, state and local laws as well as Board policy. 
Consult attorneys as needed
items.item_text: Standing Committee Composition and charge of Committee
items.item_text_raw: 1. Standing Committee Composition and charge of Committee

items.item_details:
This year, the Board Legislative Committee (BLC) supported and followed seven "Priority One" bills, two "Priority Two" bills and watched and monitored eleven additional bills.   The attached matrix provides a list of the bills and hyperlinks (embedded in each bill title) which provides the full text, history, votes and analysis of each bill.  "Hovering" over the bill title will provide a view of the link and "right clicking" and selecting "open hyperlink" will take the viewer to full access of each bill.  
	 
NOTE:  The Governor has until Sept 30th to sign or veto all bills.  
	 
The purpose of this item is to share outcomes of the work conducted and the outcomes thus far of each bill.
items.item_text: Status On 2015 State Legislative Bills Supported By SJECCD
items.item_text_raw: 1. Status On 2015 State Legislative Bills Supported By SJECCD

items.item_details: Federal legislation/issues of interest to the Board Committee on Legislation will be shared and discussed.  Specifically:  National College Promise, Immigration Reform, DREAM Act and Pell Grants.
Major events and activities involving our State legislators or local, elected officials will be shared.
items.item_text: Legislative Advocacy conducted in 2014/15 Legislative Session
items.item_text_raw: 1. Legislative Advocacy conducted in 2014/15 Legislative Session

items.item_details:
Both internal and external communication on legislative matters will be shared and discussed via the SJECCD webpage on Legislative Affairs and via the legislative media strategy and recommendations from consultant team Ford & Bonilla.  
	 
The SJECCD website includes a Legislative Affairs webpage found here:  http://www.sjeccd.edu/discover-sjeccd/chancellor/legislative-affairs  which includes the latest updates on state bills supported and followed by the Board Committee on Legislation, an all-State Bills search service as well as live video streaming of California Legislative hearings held at the State Capitol by clicking on the state hearings button.  
	 
Consultant team Ford & Bonilla will discuss optimum communications and media approaches to highlight and enhance the work of the Board Committee on Legislation.
